item.description:
abdster:

well It’s been a will since i posted the thread… i see that you guys don’t understand, so let me say my question correctly(and please try to think about what im trying to say,not how im saying it.)So… what Im saying,I think that The orginal half-life,Should be free.Why? Because if you can play the game In better graphics for free,Why would someone Pay for the exact same game,Lower Graphics,But for 10 dollars?
(I Don’t know how you guys pay,But in my country It’s 10$)And By the way I solved my apostroph thing. ^_^,now Is this clear enough?

Half-Life was created by Valve, a private video game company in the business of making and selling games.

Black Mesa is being made by fans.

It would be stupid for Valve to give up one of their products they sell because a fan-made mod was created.

Also, the Black Mesa developers do not make business decisions for Valve.

item.title: we should make half-life free for now
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
And you’re wrong. FCP, FCS, Color, Compressor, Dvd Studio Pro, Motion…I could go on and on. These are all industry standard programs (you literally cannot work as a professional in video without FCP, and Color is as good or better than anything released by the Foundry), and they’re all Mac exclusives.

Apple is smart enough to know that having overpriced, underperforming hardware requires them to have exclusive software rights to make it worth the investment. It’s as simple as that – hence people in media industries own at least one Macintosh.

Which brings us right back to the age-old fucking obvious answer, which is that Windows/Linux are good for some things and Mac is good for some things, and anyone who bitches about any of them is just a retarded fanboy.
